summary: This document contains the Articles of Incorporation and subsequent annual franchise tax reports for Nautilus, Inc., a U.S. Virgin Islands corporation formed in 2011. The corporation's purpose is 'Holding Property for Personal Use.' Jeffrey E. Epstein is listed as President/Director, with Richard Kahn as Treasurer/Director and Darren Indyke as Vice President/Secretary/Director. The filings show the corporation's financial statements and tax payments from 2011 through 2018.

persons.name: Erika A. Kellerhals

events.title: Incorporation of Nautilus, Inc.
events.description: Nautilus, Inc. is incorporated in the U.S. Virgin Islands by Erika A. Kellerhals, Gregory J. Ferguson, and Brett Geary.

events.title: Certification of Incorporation
events.description: The Lieutenant Governor of the Virgin Islands certifies the incorporation of Nautilus, Inc.

events.title: Change of Resident Agent
events.description: Nautilus, Inc. changes its resident agent from Kellerhals Ferguson LLP to Business Basics VI, LLC. The resolution is signed by Jeffrey Epstein and Darren Indyke.

locations: 9100 Havensight, Port of Sale, Suite 15-16, St. Thomas, U.S. Virgin Islands, 00802
6100 Red Hook Quarter, B3, St. Thomas, U.S. Virgin Islands 00802
keyFacts: Nautilus, Inc. was incorporated in the U.S. Virgin Islands on November 22, 2011, with the stated purpose of 'Holding Property for Personal Use.'
Jeffrey E. Epstein is listed as the President and Director of Nautilus, Inc. from its early annual reports (2012) through at least 2018.
Epstein's close associates Darren Indyke (Vice President/Secretary) and Richard Kahn (Treasurer) are also listed as officers/directors of the corporation.
The corporation's principal office changed from 9100 Havensight to 6100 Red Hook Quarter, B3, St. Thomas, between 2011 and the 2014 tax reports.
Financial statements show the corporation held significant cash assets (e.g., $40,347 in 2016) and reported consistent annual losses of $150-$441 due to administrative expenses.
